title: Where can a 3D printer be used? - Quora

response.answer_text: short answer? anywhere! I am a maker and i usually have a number of projects on the go ( …. look a squirrel!) I use my printer to print parts for machines i am attempting to build, and the immediate feedback really keeps the momentum of the builds high. I have printed marking jigs so that all the handles on by self built cupboards are exactly aligned. In the manufacturing industry i.e. injection / blow molding, a customer can hold a design in his hands before committing to the expensive investment of die making. In the medical world, printers are used to mock up prosthetic devices.Printers are used to make the Positive parts for investment casting. to quote a fellow maker ( and the designer of the Morgan 3d Printer) - you are able to hold your idea in your hand.

3D printing, also known as additive manufacturing (AM), refers to processes used to synthesize a three-dimensional object, in which successive layers of material are formed under computer control to create an object. Several projects and companies are making efforts to develop affordable 3D printers for home desktop use. There are uses of 3D Printing: Microscale and nanoscale 3D printing, Cloud-based additive manufacturing, Mass customization, Rapid manufacturing & prototyping, Food, Research, Medical applications, Agile tooling, in industries Apparel, Jewelry Industry, Automotive industry, Construction, Firearms, in Medical Medical devices, Bio-printing & Pills, Computers and robots, Space, in Socialculture Art, Communication & Domestic use, Education and research, Environmental use, Cultural Heritage and for Specialty materials 3D printing can be used.
